documentType.label: other
reasons: Document is a MetLife policy features/benefits information sheet, not an invoice or standardized medical billing form.
Contains policy feature headings, bullets, and company footer rather than fields specific to facility invoices, CMR or UB04 forms.

fields.name: Document Title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: Main Section Header
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM

fields.name: Home and Community Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services including Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care.

fields.name: Facility Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility.

fields.name: Elimination Period
fields.value: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative.

fields.name: Alternate Service Provision
fields.value: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for QLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

fields.name: Bed Reservation
fields.value: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason.

fields.name: Return of Premium
fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate.

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to the lesser of (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added, International Benefit may be modified to pay 100% of MBA outside the U.S.; EP will be 100 Calendar Days.

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase (defined by NAIC guidelines). Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA. Total benefits paid will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date.

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied. If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured. If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime.

fields.name: Premium Waiver
fields.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits.

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
fields.value: Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare; COB and non-duplication not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider.

fields.name: Payment Options
fields.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT). 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact tax deductibility of premium; client should consult a tax advisor.

fields.name: Care Coordination Services
fields.value: MetLife Care Coordinators available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services even if the family member is not insured with MetLife.

fields.name: Discounts
fields.value: 30% Spousal*, 15% Marital*, 15% Residential, 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80-84); 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases.

fields.name: Company and Address
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, New York, NY 10166

fields.name: Distribution Note
fields.value: FOR PRODUCER OR BROKER/DEALER USE ONLY. NOT FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION.

rows.value: Home and Community Care

Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services including Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care.
Facility Care
Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility.
Elimination Period
100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative.
Alternate Service Provision

A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for QLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.
Bed Reservation
Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason.
Return of Premium
If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate.
International Benefit

Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to the lesser of TBA less benefits paid while insured in the U.S. or 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy, International Benefit may be modified to pay 100% of MBA outside the U.S.; EP will be 100 Calendar Days.
Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse

Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel after a substantial premium increase; provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA; total benefits paid will not exceed the TBA in effect prior to the nonforfeiture date.
Initial Needs Assessment
1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization selected by MetLife – no cost to insured; If selected by insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime.
Premium Waiver
Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits.
Coordination of Benefits
COB and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare; not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider.

tables.caption: Additional Information For All Policies (Item / Details)

rows.value: Payment Options

Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT). 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; may impact tax deductibility; consult tax advisor.
Care Coordination Services
MetLife Care Coordinators available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts; insured can call for caregiving advice even if family member not insured with MetLife.
Discounts
30% Spousal*, 15% Marital*, 15% Residential, 10% Preferred Health (N/A ages 80-84); 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases.
Underwriting Classes
Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80-84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!).
Save Age
Premium based on age 30 days prior to application date (underwriting requirements based on age at date of signed application).
Policy Effective Dates
With Premium: Date all underwriting requirements are met (Conditional Receipt may apply); Without Premium: 28 days following underwriting approval date.
Free Look Period
Insured has 30 days to review policy and, if desired, return it for a full refund.
Policy Delivery
Policy Delivery Receipt (PDR) must be signed within 30 days of Policy Approval Date.
